newsitem.title: USA: Sony to offer warranty on digital TV goods.
newsitem.headline: Sony to offer warranty on digital TV goods.

text.p: Sony said Sunday it is introducing a policy to cut replacement costs for broadcasters making the transition to digital television.
It said its new policy provides a three-year warranty on parts and one-year labor for its Betacam SX digital products, including camcorders, hybrid recorders/editors and portable editors.
"We are standing behind our products with a warranty that is unmatched today in the broadcast industry," the company said in a release.
Digital TV offers crisp, clear pictures, CD-quality sound and enables the transmission of up to 10 compressed digital programs on the same cable bandwidth taken up by one analog program.
The Federal Commnications Commision is detailing rules for digital TV, which promises to be the biggest change in TV viewing since the introduction of color pictures in the 1950s.
